intro: Galium propinquum var. elongatum, commonly known as the long-stemmed bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowering stems are often elongated, giving it its varietal name "elongatum."
